info.title: Chemspace
info.description:
## About Chemspace API

Chemspace API provides access to Chemspace database. The API allows performing a search by identifiers (CAS, MFCD, vendor code, etc.) and structure-related search (exact match, substructure, and similarity). As a result of the search, a user can get information on vendors, pricing, packing, dispatching time for the Chemspace Building Blocks and Screening compounds.

## Get API Key

In order to use the Chemspace API, you need to get API key first. The API key looks like the following

    c2JGNzCqj771pc9q-VwnuA75XjqQsnwoJMq_F76sH1lHQWT2JQ0UXN8aZmo4g7BP

The API key is unique. To get your API key, please contact us at **info@chem-space.com**.

## Number of API requests

Please note that with your API key you can perform a limited number of API requests (**40** per minute). You can find the information regarding the remaining number of the requests in headers.

## Data interchange formats

The Chemspace API communicates via a JSON or an XML formats. You can use **Accept** header to manage the response format.

For the JSON-format:

    Accept: application/json

For the XML-format:

    Accept: application/xml

## API Versions

The latest version of the Chemspace API is 2.6. We recommend you to use the latest version to have access to all the available functionality at the time. We, however, support previous versions for the compatibility with the legacy code.

The version of the API has to be provided in the URL right after the address (**https://api.chem-space.com**) in `/v{major_version}/` path component and in Accept header, 
`Accept: application/{format}; version={version}`.

To use the Chemspace API, version **1.3**, the **endpoint** would be the following

    https://api.chem-space.com/v1/search/cas/93-10-7

And the Accept header for the JSON format

    Accept: application/json; version=1.3

For the XML format

    Accept: application/xml; version=1.3

To use the Chemspace API, version **2.2**, the **endpoint** would be the following

    https://api.chem-space.com/v2/search/cas/93-10-7

And the Accept header for the JSON format

    Accept: application/json; version=2.2
    
For the XML format

    Accept: application/xml; version=2.2

Note. For the Chemspace API where minor version is zero (i.e. 1.0, 2.0), the minor version can be omitted in the Accept header.

## Related Links

Some responses include related links to other API queries. These links are found in the response body in the `_links` element. For example,

    "_links": [
          {
              "rel": "prices",
              "href": "https://api.chem-space.com/v2/cs-id/CSC000210223/prices",
              "method": "GET"
          },
          {
              "rel": "prices (tier 1)",
              "href": "https://api.chem-space.com/v2/cs-id/CSC000210223/tier1/prices",
              "method": "GET"
          }
      ]

where:
- **rel** - link description;
- **href** - resource URL;
- **method** - HTTP-method used (GET, POST, etc.)

## API Authentication

The Chemspace API uses a two-layer authorization. First layer: user provides the **API Key** in order to obtain an **Access Token**. Second layer: user provides, the received **Access Token** to obtain the data from the endpoint. **Warning! API Key and Access Token must be kept confidential and should not be given to third parties or publicized!**

Both, the **API Key** and the **Access Token** are encoded 64-symbol strings. Both strings are sent in **Authorization header** as `Authorization: Bearer {value_of_key/token}` during the corresponding endpoint calls.

Please note that

**API Key** (obtained by sending a request to info@chem-space.com) is used **only** for getting the **Access Token**.

**Access Token** is used to get the data. It can be obtained at **https://api.chem-space.com/auth/token** endpoint.

**Access Token** expires in 4 hours. New **Access Token** can be received at **https://api.chem-space.com/auth/token** endpoint. If **Access Token** has expired, a user receives the response message with status-code *401 Unauthorized* and a value of 1 of the "**code**" field in the body of the message.

![401 Unauthorized](img/401.png)

Please note that the "**code**" field can have the different values:

0, "Your request was made with invalid credentials"

1, "Access token has expired"

2, "The user is banned"

3, "The user is inactive"

**When using Chemspace API, both the API key and the Access Token are transferred via a secured connection (https) and the authorization runs via HTTP Bearer Tokens.** All the details regarding sending the API Key and the Access Token are given below in Get Access Token section.

# Interactive Documentation

The following documentation is interactive you can run any query through the Chemspace API on the same page. To do this for each endpoint, please use **"Try it out"** button to fill in the necessary query parameters (if any) and then press **"Execute"** button.

  ![Try it out](img/btn-try-it-out.png)

Please remember that you may need to use the **Access Token** for the authentication for some endpoints in the Interactive Documentation, except for *Get Access Token by API Key*.

## Authorization In Interactive Documentation

Some endpoints can be executed without using the **Access Token** or the **API Key** but most requires authorization. For Get Access Token by API Key endpoint, the authorization is performed with the **API Key**, for the other endpoints, with the **Access Token**.
## Get Access Token

Initially, you need to get a valid **Access Token**. For this, you need to use *Get Access Token by API Key* endpoint (first in the list of the endpoints).

  ![1st line](img/1st_line.png)

In the open menu item press on the lock icon on the right side.

  ![Access Token lock](img/access_token_lock.png)
  
Provide your **API Key** in "Value" field of a pop-up window.
  
  ![Access Token](img/authorize-api-key.png)

Please remember, to get the **API Key** please contact us at **info@chem-space.com**.

Next, press **"Try it out"** button

  ![Try it out button (auth)](img/try-it-out-auth.png)

And **"Execute"** button to run the endpoint

  ![Execute button](img/exec-button.png)

The valid **Access Token** is found in the response body section

  ![Access Token Value](img/access-token-val.png)

## Get Secure Endpoints Data

The endpoints requiring authorization are marked with a lock icon on the right.

  ![Lock](img/btn-lock.png)

Pressing the lock icon opens a pop-up window to enter credentials

  ![Access Token](img/authorize-access-token.png)

You must provide a valid **Access Token** in the "Value" field.

Also, you can add all the credentials in the "Authorization" pop-up window by pressing **Authorize** button.

  
  ![Authorize all](img/btn-authorize.png)
  
And then enter your valid credentials

  ![Authorize](img/authorize.png)
  
---

tags: Get Access Token by API Key
get.description:
## Get Access Token by API Key
To get a new Access Token you need to perform a bearer token authorization.
The Bearer Token is your API Key. You should send Authorization header in the request.
The value of the header should be <nobr>***"Bearer \<API Key\>"***</nobr>.

The string should look like the following
######
    Authorization: Bearer c2JGNzCqj771pc9q-VwnuA75XjqQsnwoJMq_F76sH1lHQWT2JQ0UXN8aZmo4g7BP
### Example
Get Access Token by API Key ***c2JGNzCqj771pc9q-VwnuA75XjqQsnwoJMq_F76sH1lHQWT2JQ0UXN8aZmo4g7BP***
### Example request:
    curl -X GET \
      "https://api.chem-space.com/auth/token" \
      -H  "Accept: application/json" \
      -H  "Authorization: Bearer c2JGNzCqj771pc9q-VwnuA75XjqQsnwoJMq_F76sH1lHQWT2JQ0UXN8aZmo4g7BP"
### Example response
    {
      "access_token": "rVZEV12feW1axECAqJUu1dy7j8gxyNVqzSZoGY1LdKI8xvVXybBaaa7QLIJzoqfP",
      "expires_in": 3600,
      "api_key": "c2JGNzCqj771pc9q-VwnuA75XjqQsnwoJMq_F76sH1lHQWT2JQ0UXN8aZmo4g7BP"
    }
### Properties
- **access_token** - *string*, Access Token - unique string that is passed with every API call.
- **expires_in** - *int*, time (in seconds) before the expiration of the Access Token
- **api_key** - *string*, your current API Key.

## Get prices (tier 1) by Chemspace ID
At this endpoint you can find information about prices, amounts, and shipping time by a Chemspace ID. The information is available for the Tier 1 suppliers
(["Abamachem Ltd"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/5),
["BCH Research LLP"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/bch-research),
["Curpys Chemicals"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/183),
["Enamine Ltd"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/11),
["FCH Group"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/fch-group),
["Intermed Ltd"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/8),
["Selena Chem Ltd"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/9),
["UORSY"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/10))
only.
### Example
Get prices (tier 1) by Chemspace ID ***CSC000000066***
### Example request:
    curl -X GET \
      "https://api.chem-space.com/v2/cs-id/CSC000000066/tier1/prices" \
      -H  "Accept: application/json; version=2.6" \
      -H  "Authorization: Bearer rVZEV12feW1axECAqJUu1dy7j8gxyNVqzSZoGY1LdKI8xvVXybBaaa7QLIJzoqfP"
### Example response
    {
      "count": 2,
      "CS-id": "CSC000000066",

            },
            {
              "pack_g": 10,

            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "vendor_name": "UORSY",
          "vendor_code": "BBV-38119652",
          "ships_within": 30,
          "prices": [
            {
              "pack_g": 0.001,
              "in_stock": false,

          "rel": "prices (tier 1)",

          "method": "GET"
        }
      ]
    }
### Properties
  - **count** - *int*, number of elements in *items*
  - **CS-id** - *string*, Chemspace ID
  - **link** - *string*, Chemspace URL
  - **smiles** - *string | null*, SMILES of compound
  - **iupac_name** - *string | null*, IUPAC (International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry) name
  - **molweight** - *double | null*, molecular weight
  - **molformula** - *string | null*, chemical formula
  - **cas** - *string | null*, CAS (Chemical Abstracts Service) number
  - **mfcd** - *string | null*, MFCD number
  - **items** - *array*, found suppliers
    * **vendor_name** - *string*, supplier's company
    * **vendor_code** - *string*, supplier's code
    * **ships_within** - *int*, number of days for shipping
    * **prices** - *array*, pricing info
      * **pack_g** - *double*, package weight in grams
      * **in_stock** - *boolean*, in stock
      * **price_usd** - *double*, price in USD
      * **price_eur** - *double | null*, price in EUR
  - **_links** - *array*, a list of related links
    - **rel** - *string*, describes the type of link
    - **href** - *string*, URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action.
    - **method** - *string*, the HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in *href*

## Get prices by Chemspace ID list
At this endpoint you can find information about prices, amounts, and shipping time by a Chemspace ID list. Information from all the suppliers is included.
### Example
Get prices by Chemspace IDs:
- ***CSC000694108***
- ***61***
- ***CSC000694109***
- ***123***
- ***CSC000000056***
- ***CSC000001818***
- ***65***
- ***CSC123456789***
### Example request:
    curl -X POST \
      "https://api.chem-space.com/v2/list/cs-id/prices?skip=3&count=2" \
      -H  "Accept: application/json; version=2.6" \
      -H  "Authorization: Bearer rVZEV12feW1axECAqJUu1dy7j8gxyNVqzSZoGY1LdKI8xvVXybBaaa7QLIJzoqfP" \
      -H  "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \

## Get prices (tier 1) by Chemspace ID list
At this endpoint you can find information about prices, amounts, and shipping time by a Chemspace ID list. The information is available for the Tier 1 suppliers
(["Abamachem Ltd"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/5),
["BCH Research LLP"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/bch-research),
["Curpys Chemicals"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/183),
["Enamine Ltd"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/11),
["FCH Group"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/fch-group),
["Intermed Ltd"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/8),
["Selena Chem Ltd"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/9),
["UORSY"](https://chem-space.com/supplier/10))
only.

Get prices by Chemspace IDs:
- ***CSC000694108***
- ***61***
- ***CSC000694109***
- ***123***
- ***CSC000000056***
- ***CSC000001818***
- ***65***

## Advanced search by SMILES
Exact search by SMILES in the REAL database.
### Example
Advanced search by SMILES ***CC(N)=O***
### Example request:
    curl -X POST \
      "https://api.chem-space.com/v2/search/advanced/1/exact" \
      -H "Accept: application/json; version=2.6" \
      -H "Authorization: Bearer rVZEV12feW1axECAqJUu1dy7j8gxyNVqzSZoGY1LdKI8xvVXybBaaa7QLIJzoqfP" \
      -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
      -F "SMILES=CC(N)=O"
### Example response
    {
      "count": 1,
      "items": [
        {
          "smiles": "CC(N)=O",
          "vendor_id": "PV-001820522019",
          "mw": 59.07,
          "hac": 4,
          "logp": -1.03,
          "rotb": 0,
          "hba": 1,
          "hbd": 1,
          "ring_count": 0,
          "fsp3": 0.5,
          "tpsa": 43.1,
          "id": "CSCR00000000001"
        }
     ]
    }
### Properties
  - **count** - *int*, number of elements in *items*
  - **items** - *array*, found compounds
    - **smiles** - *string*, SMILES of compound
    - **vendor_id** - *string*, REAL database Vendor ID
    - **mw** - *double*, MW (PhysChem parameter)
    - **hac** - *int*, Heavy Atoms (PhysChem parameter)
    - **logp** - *double*, ClogP (PhysChem parameter)
    - **rotb** - *int*, Rotatable Bonds (PhysChem parameter)
    - **hba** - *int*, H-bond Acceptors (PhysChem parameter)
    - **hbd** - *int*, H-bond Donors (PhysChem parameter)
    - **ring_count** - *int*, Rings (PhysChem parameter)
    - **fsp3** - *double*, Fsp3 (PhysChem parameter)
    - **tpsa** - *double*, TPSA (PhysChem parameter)
    - **id** - *string*, Chemspace identifier from REAL database
